questions.question: 1)In industrial settings, resonant density sensors are often used in:
2)The response time of a resonant sensor for liquid density measurement is generally:

answers.b: Very fast, within milliseconds to seconds
answers.c: Variable, depending on the liquid color

questions.difficulty: Very fast, within milliseconds to seconds

questions.question: 3)The main challenge in measuring highly viscous liquids using resonant sensors is:

answers.c: Excessive damping of the sensors vibrations

questions.difficulty: Excessive damping of the sensor's vibrations

questions.question: 4)Which of the following is a common application for resonant liquid density sensors?

answers.d: Measuring gas density in oil pipelines

questions.question: 5)A resonant sensorâ€™s ability to measure density is most accurate when:

answers.c: The sensor is exposed to open air
answers.d: The liquid is mixed with air bubbles

questions.question: 6)Damping in a resonant sensor refers to:

answers.a: The reduction in vibration amplitude due to liquid viscosity
answers.c: The increase in mass due to liquid density

questions.difficulty: The reduction in vibration amplitude due to liquid viscosity
